name: Ratings
description: Professional rating system for Jellyfin. Rate media with 1-10 stars, view detailed user ratings on hover, and see rating badges on media cards. Optimized for large libraries with lazy loading.
overview: Comprehensive rating plugin with star-based UI, average ratings display, detailed user rating popups, and performance-optimized card overlays for large media libraries.

versions.changelog: DEBUG: Added console logging to diagnose Media button issue.
Fixed Media button - now follows exact same pattern as Latest Media button for reliable injection.
Media button now in header - replaces original search button (admin only). Responsive design matches other header buttons.
Fixed Media button injection - now properly finds and injects into Jellyfin's mainDrawer sidebar after Dashboard link.
Media Management moved to Dashboard sidebar - click 'Media' in Server section when in admin Dashboard.
Admin Media Management: New 'Media' button for admins with full library view, stats, filtering, and scheduled deletion with 'Leaving in X days' badges visible to all users.
Latest Media improvements: clean titles (no IMDB IDs), time ago indicator, solid header background.
New Latest Media button replaces Sync Play - shows dropdown with 50 most recently added movies/series with type badges.
Fixed rating removal by clicking same star - added session token auth fallback to DELETE endpoint.
Fixed dropdown stacking: moved to body element. Fixed search input white background on focus/autocomplete.
Fixed dropdown z-index - dropdown now appears above all other elements.
Fixed dropdown search positioning - dropdown now correctly appears below search field using fixed positioning.
Dropdown search: Search now shows results in a dropdown below the search field without changing the main page. Searches entire media library. Fixed admin tab text grammar.
Snooze UI: Date picker and snooze/unsnooze buttons in admin view. Requests now grouped by status categories (Processing > Pending > Snoozed > Done > Rejected).
Admin request UI: When EnableAdminRequests is ON, admins see tabs to switch between Create Request and Manage Requests views.
Users can now edit and delete their own pending requests. Edit/Delete buttons appear only on pending requests.

Major request system update: Admin requests option, request limits per month, auto-delete rejected requests, snooze requests, fully customizable form fields (enable/disable/required), click same star to remove rating, API for user request editing.
New API endpoint: GET /Ratings/Users/{userId}/Ratings returns all items rated by a specific user. Also added GET /Ratings/MyRatings for current user's ratings.
Added IMDB Code and IMDB Link optional fields to request form. Both displayed in user and admin views with IMDB yellow styling.
All customization options now accessible in plugin settings page: search button, language switch, notification icon, custom request fields, and request form texts.
New customization options: Toggle language switch, search button, and notification icon visibility in plugin settings. Reject requests with reason. Custom request form fields and texts.
Fixed notification system: Session-based tracking prevents old notifications on page refresh. Only media added after login triggers notifications. Proper logout handling.
Improved middleware - better error handling, strict path matching, proper stream handling.
Fixed HTTP middleware - handles compressed responses correctly. Fixes Docker permission issues (issue #1).
Completely silent logging - no more notification polling logs at all. Server only logs errors now.
Reduced server logging - notification polling no longer floods logs every 10 seconds. Only logs when notifications are found.
Fixed notification toggle hover tooltip - now shows popup on hover.
Language translation! EN/LT toggle in request modal. Button, form, status messages, and admin interface all translated.
Improved notification queue: 2-10 min random delay between notifications, 24h duplicate prevention, better error handling. All queued media will be shown.
Added 470px breakpoint: top:10px, right:180px for very small screens.
Added 590px breakpoint: top:58px, right:130px for smaller screens.
Mobile: toggle at top:55px, right:150px - second row left of Request button.
Mobile: toggle now sticks to LEFT of Request button (right:170px). Desktop: toggle left of search field.
Fixed toggle position: now truly LEFT of search (right:755px). Tooltip now uses fixed positioning to avoid clipping.
Notification toggle moved to LEFT of search field. Added hover tooltip explaining the toggle function.
Fixed notification toggle position - now correctly placed between search field and request button.
Added notification toggle slider in header near search field. Users can enable/disable notifications. Responsive design.
Fixed season number - now gets from parent folder structure using GetParent(). Debug logging to track data.
Fixed season number not showing - now uses fallback to episode.Season.IndexNumber. Added debug logging.
Fixed SeriesName not showing - now uses fallback to episode.Series.Name. Notifications show: SeriesName S01 + Episode X
Fixed episode number display - no more '?' for episode 0. Proper null/zero handling for season and episode numbers.
Episode notifications show season (S01). Added settings: Enable Notifications, Group Episodes. Fire TV app updated for grouped episodes.
Episode grouping! Multiple episodes added at once now show as single notification 'New episodes available: 4-8' instead of 5 separate notifications.
Fix browser real-time notifications: CreatedAt timestamp now set when notification is released from queue, not when queued.
Fix notifications not showing: now also listens to ItemUpdated events to catch when metadata/images are added after item creation.
Fix duplicate notifications: only notify when image is ready, prevent same item from being notified twice.
Clean titles: automatically removes IMDB IDs like [tt14364480] from notification titles.
Removed test notification button from web UI - use TV app for testing instead.
Episode notification format: Shows 'Series Name (year)' on first line and 'Episode X is available' on second line.
Removed system notifications. Added 1-3 minute random delay between notifications when multiple media items are added.
Episode notifications! Now get notified when new episodes are added. Shows series name with S01E01 format. Test button can also show random episodes.
WebSocket diagnostics for test button! Now shows WARNING in logs when Fire TV/Android TV cannot receive notifications due to WebSocket being blocked by reverse proxy.

WebSocket diagnostics! Now logs WARNING when sessions lack WebSocket support (SupportsRemoteControl=false). Helps diagnose Fire TV/Android TV notification issues caused by reverse proxy blocking WebSocket.
Debug logging with WARNING level to ensure visibility in logs.
Debug logging for native app sessions. Now logs all sessions with device info to diagnose Firestick notification issues.
Native app notifications! Now sends DisplayMessage to all connected clients (Firestick, Android TV, iOS, etc.) when new media is added. Web notifications unchanged.
Test button hides instantly when non-admin logs in. All buttons hidden on login page. Test notification now shows random movie/series from your library with poster!
Fixed notifications for all users! Added debug logging, improved UTC date handling, and set initial check time to 5 minutes ago so all users receive notifications.
Fixed test notification button positioning - moved left to avoid overlap with search field.

New media notifications! Get notified when new movies/series are added to the library. Notifications appear in bottom-left corner even during fullscreen playback. Admins can send test notifications via button in header.
Removed double scrollbar issue. Only Netflix container scrolls now, body/html overflow hidden when genre view active.
Fixed header scrolling with Netflix genre view. Header now stays fixed at top when scrolling through genre rows.

Major fix! Changed results container to fixed position overlay appended to body instead of mainAnimatedPage. Added MutationObserver to detect style modifications. Added delayed visibility checks. Should finally work after navigation!
Visibility fix! Forced results container to display with explicit CSS: display:block, visibility:visible, opacity:1, z-index:1000. Should now be visible after navigation!
Extended debug logging! Logs homepage sections count, HTML building, and results visibility. Check console for detailed diagnostics.
Debug version with logging! Always recreates results container fresh. Added console logs to track search behavior. Please check browser console (F12) for 'RatingsPlugin:' messages.
Search fixes! Fixed card images not loading in search results. Auto-clears search results when navigating away from homepage. Search now works correctly after returning to homepage.
Homepage Full Library Search! Search field on homepage now queries entire library using Jellyfin API instead of just filtering visible content. Results display as clickable cards.
Auto-detection! Added MutationObserver to detect when Netflix content loads dynamically. No more manual window resize needed - genre titles appear automatically!
Perfect fix! Back to 50px padding. Added .netflix-genre-title to selectors so genre row titles (Action, Adventure, etc.) are properly visible below header. Cards remain visible!
Increased padding to 80px! Both header and content now use 80px padding to fully show card titles below header on Movies/TV pages. Added .netflix-view-container back.
Netflix genre rows fixed! Changed selector from .netflix-view-container to .netflix-genre-row to properly target card parent containers. Cards no longer covered!
Netflix cards fixed! Added .netflix-view-container to paddingTop selectors. Custom Netflix-style card view now properly pushed down on Movies/TV pages.
Fixed content overlap! Changed marginTop to paddingTop on multiple content containers (.mainAnimatedPage, .itemsContainer, .verticalSection). Content now properly pushed down.
SPA navigation detection! Auto-updates on page changes with URL monitoring (300ms), popstate, and hashchange listeners. No more manual refresh needed!
Fixed content push! Added 50px marginTop to main content area on Movies/TV pages. Header paddingBottom back to 50px. Content now properly pushed down.
Minimal header extension! Reduced paddingBottom to 10px (from 50px) on Movies/TV pages. Removed minHeight to prevent covering content.
URL-based detection! Now ONLY extends header on Movies/TV pages (#/movies or #/tv URLs). Home unchanged. Reduced extension: 110px minHeight, 50px padding.
Extended header height! .emby-tabs-slider now expands with minHeight: 150px and paddingBottom: 60px at ≤925px to show search/button.
FIXED positioning! Removed !important from CSS top values so JavaScript can control positioning. Now works correctly on all pages.
Page-aware positioning! Search/button at top: 105px on Movies/TV Shows pages with tabs, top: 55px on Home. Auto-detects .emby-tabs-slider at ≤925px.
Dynamic button width! Request button padding now scales dynamically (8-16px) matching search field behavior. Both elements resize proportionally.
Optimized mobile layout! Button padding 8px 16px, search width 100px, both at top: 55px for perfect alignment at 925px breakpoint.
Header-attached layout! Elements now scroll with header (position: absolute). Extra search width scaling below 500px. Same size/alignment for both elements.
JavaScript-based dynamic scaling! CSS calc() replaced with JS for reliable responsive scaling from 100% (925px) to 50% (300px).
FIXED dynamic scaling! Using clamp() to ensure proper responsive behavior. Elements now smoothly scale from 100% (925px) to 50% (300px).
Dynamic responsive scaling! Elements scale smoothly from 100% at 925px to 50% at 300px using calc() formula. Perfect fluid layout.
Compact mobile view! Both search field and request button scaled to 50% (transform: scale(0.5)) at 925px breakpoint. Optimized spacing.
Responsive layout update! Search field sticks to left (left: 6px), Request button sticks to right (right: 6px). Mobile breakpoint: 925px.
Fixed mobile CSS! Search field (right: 288px, padding: 6px 1px), Request button (right: 6px, font-size: 16px, border-radius: 55px). Works in mobile view and small windows.
Mobile layout update! Search field and Request button repositioned for better mobile viewing (top: 65px, optimized spacing).
Removed all debug console.log statements for cleaner browser console. Plugin now runs silently without logging.
Fixed auto-clear for SPA navigation! Now monitors URL changes every 500ms to detect page changes in single-page app.
Auto-clear search on page navigation! Search field now clears when you navigate to a different page.
Fixed search on Netflix view pages! Now filters Netflix-style cards correctly. Works on all library pages.
Fixed search filtering on Movies/TV Shows library pages. Improved card detection with better selectors and title extraction.
Live search filtering! Type to instantly filter movies/series on current page. Icon changes to X when typing - click to clear.
Added search field in header! Search directly from homepage and all pages without navigating to search page first.
Fixed logo aspect ratio to match Jellyfin plugin container (16:9).
Simplified plugin logo SVG for better compatibility. Fixed plugin logo display.
Fixed plugin logo to fit container properly. Added Netflix view screenshot to README. All features are now documented as optional in settings.
Restored card hover animation. Added setting to enable/disable Request Media button in plugin config.
Fixed scroll behavior - mouse wheel now scrolls page, not genre rows. Removed card hover scaling. Scroll buttons always visible (higher z-index).
Header visible! Netflix view now starts below header (top: 56px). Added rating badges to Netflix cards showing user ratings on each card.
Fixed overlay! Netflix view now uses position:fixed fullscreen overlay attached to body. No more dependency on parent container visibility. Works on first navigation!
Force visibility fix! Inline styles with !important to override Jellyfin CSS that was hiding Netflix container on SPA navigation.
Netflix View fixes: Random shuffle per genre (no repeats at top), higher z-index, hide all content containers, better parent detection. Should work on SPA navigation!
DEBUG: Enhanced Netflix View logging. Multiple container selectors, retry logic, detailed console output to diagnose SPA navigation issues.
Smooth Netflix View! No more refresh needed - activates instantly on navigation. Hidden default layout prevents flickering. MutationObserver for reliable detection.
Fixed crash on init! Emby.Page.addEventListener compatibility fix for Jellyfin 10.11. Netflix View should now work.
DEBUG: Netflix View with console logging to diagnose issues.
Netflix View fix! Improved URL detection for #/movies and #/tv pages with topParentId parameter.
Netflix-Style View! Enable in plugin settings to display libraries with horizontal genre rows like Netflix. Movies and TV shows organized by genre with smooth scrolling.
Watch Now button now shows for admins too! Updated README with full Request Media documentation and screenshots.
Fixed button initialization! Retry logic for SPA navigation, smarter login page detection that doesn't block logged-in users. No more Ctrl+Shift+R needed!
Login page fix! Button hides on login/startup pages. Cache clears on logout and account switch to prevent stale data between users.
Full request management! Delete requests, timestamps (requested/completed), media link input for admins. Users see timestamps and 'Watch Now' button when request is fulfilled!
Mobile-friendly admin table! Card layout on mobile, dropdown select for status changes instead of 3 buttons. Modal now 95% width on mobile for better viewing.
Animation fix v2: Removed box-shadow conflict, fixed transition property, added vendor prefixes for webkit/moz/o. Animations should now work properly!
Fixed shine animation! Removed invalid !important from @keyframes. Mobile button repositioned to right: 190px with border-radius: 15px.
Mobile responsive! Request Media button now 70% smaller on mobile devices (screens under 768px), positioned to the right for better fit. Desktop unchanged.
Perfect positioning (top: 8px), working shine animation with gradient sweep, smart badge that disappears when you view completed requests! All polished and working smoothly.
Stunning shine animation! Button aligned with header, no icon, text shines with gradient sweep. Badge updates instantly when admin marks requests as done. Beautiful & functional!
Premium UX! Grey centered button with pulse animation, notification badges (admins see pending count, users see completed count), super compact tables, wider modal. Professional look!
Enhanced Request Media: Button moved left, tooltip on hover, dropdown type selector (Movie/TV Series/Anime/etc), description box, users see their own requests with live status updates!
Full Request Media system! User interface for submitting requests, admin interface for managing requests with status updates (pending/processing/done). Button repositioned to avoid blocking UI.
SAFE Request Media button! Fully isolated with error handling, won't crash Jellyfin. Top-right corner, hides during video.
Improved mobile/tablet layout with margin-left: 136px at max-width: 1312px for better positioning.
Fixed mobile layout! Rating stars now display properly on mobile devices with responsive design.
Removed all console logging for production. Clean and optimized code.
FIXED: Series rating badges now working! Series items have data-isfolder=true but are valid media items.
DEBUG VERSION: Added extensive console logging to diagnose series card detection issues.
Enhanced card detection using data-id attributes. More reliable detection of series and movie cards.
Fixed rating badges not appearing on TV series cards. Improved URL filtering to allow series-specific links.
